turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: What the hell...

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: They're out of towners... Arizona plates...

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Ten thousand right here.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: There must be over a million dollars in here.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Shit, more than that.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: What are we going to do?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: What do you mean what are we going to do?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I mean -- Earl grabs Booth's arm --

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Call it in I guess.  Why?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Why?  Are you kidding me?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: No.  We can't.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Look around you partner!  You said yourself you never saw anything like it.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: We don't know whose money it is!  They might have robbed a bank, who knows?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Robbed a bank, c'mon!  Don't you think we would have heard if one, two --  shit I don't know how many were at large!  Don't you think there would be a bulletin?  This is a big ass drug deal!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: We don't know that.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Come on Booth!  Look at these scumbags around us.  Who's going to know what happened!  Let's take it and get out of here!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Well someone's gonna find them.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Hell, it won't be us!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: It won't work.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I told Trudy we were coming down this way, that's why!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: We'll figure something out.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: We would never have to worry about money -- ever again, Jesus!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Suppose someone knows about the money?  They're bound to ask questions.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Who's going to question us? Dwayne?  Jesse?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: It's going to go bigger than that. Could you stare someone straight in the face and lie about it?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I'll worry about that when it happens and if it happens, and it's not gonna happen!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: What makes you so sure?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Because...I know.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: It's no accident we stumbled on this money.  It's an answer to a prayer!  Every night and every day I've prayed that God would just -- help me out a little, give me a little push.  Tonight my prayer came true.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Oh so God's like Western Union and he just dropped us a couple million bucks?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: That's right!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: At the expense of six people.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: They killed themselves.  Besides, they were breaking the law.  What they were doing was wrong!  Whatsamatter Booth, don't you believe in miracles?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: All right hold on!  Lemme think...  Shit, did you touch the car?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Maybe.  Who cares?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I do.  It's little shit like that sends people to jail! We have to cover all the bases if we're going to pull this!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: All right we will.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: We'll torch the bases, how's that?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Torch it?!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: We'll leave a few packets in the trunk, and stash the rest somewhere else.  Car went up in the gunfight.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I've got one condition.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: We're going to be patient. If we start flashing money around, buying fancy cars and fancy clothes, people are going to ask questions.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Well, we won't do any of that shit!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Shhh!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: What are you gonna do?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Well, I don't know.  I'm putting it out of my mind and you should too --

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I don't know!  Son of a bitch! Who the hell are you?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: He saw everything!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: How long you been lying there playing possum with us, huh? Answer me!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: He'll tell them everything to save his ass. That's how they all work it!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I'm not letting some gangbanger send me to jail.  We can't risk it.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: What are you thinking?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: You're thinking about killing him.  I can't do that.  No way.  I've never killed a man.  Never even shot at one...

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Well neither have I, but it's us or him.  If he talks, or writes a note, or whatever, he's gonna turn us in.  Besides, he's a low life scumbag.  His kind is hardly even human anyway.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I...I can't do that.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Okay then.  I'll do it.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: That's not what I mean.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Listen. Do you want to go to jail? Taking evidence, tampering with a crime scene.  You know what they'd do.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I tell you it was a miracle the way things turned out --

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I don't want to hear about miracles and God and all that!  We tried to murder someone to cover our asses!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Well we didn't kill him, he died on his own.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Look.  Dwayne was right.  This is going to be a big story.  So big in fact that I don't want to even have this money around.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Fair enough, I'll take it to my place.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Forget it.  We're going to bury it, and we're not going to even think about it until everything dies down.  And no one, I mean no one hears a word about it.	 Understand?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: We're dead.  We're dead, We are dead...  What are we going to do?!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: This isn't a joke. What are we going to do!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I don't know you want me to put on my cape and fly there?!  We're going to play it cool... besides there might be nothing on that tape anyway...

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: That guy was a Federal agent. An officer of the law, just like us.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Well, we didn't know that at the time.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: We assaulted a Federal agent.  We killed him.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: No we didn't.  He died on his own.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Oh, right, with a little help from his pals Booth and Earl.  I'm sure that's gonna fly real far when they hear that tape...

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: We gotta turn ourselves in, before they hear the tape.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Are you nuts?  They'll fry us for sure.  There's no way we're doin' that, you understand?  No way.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: It's the right thing to do.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: It's the stupid thing to do, that's what it is.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I should have known something like this was going to happen!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Man take it easy!  You're sweating like crazy!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: How long you been lying there playing possum with us, huh? Answer me!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: He'll tell them everything to save his ass. That's how they all work it!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Shit!  We're gonna have to get rid of him.  I'm not letting some gangbanger ruin my life.  We can't risk it.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: What are you thinking?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: You're thinking about killing him. I can't do that.  No way.  I've never killed a man.  Never even shot at one.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Well neither have I, but it's us or him.  If he talks, or writes a note	or whatever, he's gonna turn us in.  Besides, he's just a low life scumbag.  His kind is hardly even human anyway.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I can't do that.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Okay then.  I'll do it.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: That's not what I mean.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Listen.  Do you want to go to jail? Taking evidence, tampering with a crime scene.  You know what they'd do.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: He would have done it to us, right?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Exactly.  This is our little secret, partner.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I could kill that no good son of a bitch!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: All right enough!  I'm tired of thinking about all this!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Well I'm not!  Thinks he's got us by the balls.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Well doesn't he?  Besides if the DEA heard that tape we'd be behind bars right now.  Just call it the cost of doing business.  This whole thing is screwed up.  I'm thinking.  Maybe we should tell 'em the truth...

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: ...Or get rid of the money.  I don't know.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I've got a better idea.  All we have to do is straighten out Jesse.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: And how do you figure we do that?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: All we have to do is get our hands on the original tape.  We'll set him up somehow.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: He's probably made copies.  He's not going to give them up to us.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Forget the copies!  He could have made up the copies -- the only thing that incriminates us is the original.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: He's going to be trouble.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: He's a partner now, Earl, like it or not.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: We had a deal!  What was I, talking to the wall?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: For Christ's sake, Booth, I just needed to take care of a few debts is all!  You got my word on it --I'm not going near it again until everything cools down.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: You said that last time!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Well I mean it this time.  Come on.  Let's get this over with!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: You're out of your mind.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Yeah, I mean you're coming unglued, Jesse.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: You think he's bluffing?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Neither do I.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Look, Earl.  We gotta go straight. This is all messed up...

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: If you're any friend at all, you'll stop talking like that!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Maybe we can reason with Jesse, give him a third in exchange for the tape.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I don't think he's going to be doing any bargaining with us, the stupid son-of-a-bitch!  Besides, I'm not giving him a third of anything, not after everything we had to do.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Well what are we supposed to do?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I don't know...we have to shut him up somehow. Booth looks at Earl --

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: You're crazy.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: How badly do you want that money?! How bad do you want to stay out of jail?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Not bad enough to kill him.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Who said anything about killing?  Just keep driving straight...

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: How long is it going to take?!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I don't know!  Shit, give me a break!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: What are you thinking?  We were only supposed to scare him!

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I'm just making our intentions clear. Go check the desk.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Here it is.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: There it is...now what about the others?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Even if we have the tape, that wouldn't shut him up!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: You killed him...

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: It's gonna be o.k.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Like hell it is.  This is Jesse! Jesse!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Jesus Christ Earl...what are we doing?...

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: We're doing what we gotta do, to protect ourselves!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: You don't know if he was really gonna --

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Yes I DO!  It never woulda stopped, you know that.  Jesse's always gonna be making mistakes and we'd be paying for them for the rest of our lives.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Maybe we should say somethin'.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Come on. Booth grabs the bag --

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Do you have everything?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I sure as hell hope so.  Let's go.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I don't know for sure, but why else would they head for the bank?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: It was all used.  Random numbers. How can they trace it?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I don't know.  They got all kinds of high-tech shit nowadays.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Then we're screwed.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: No we're not.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: We're not?  How do you figure that?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: We'll take the money and disappear! We can do it, spend it on the move. Even if all of it's marked, there's ways around it.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: We've got to go now, then.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Then Sally comes too.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Oh Jesus...

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: He killed her...he killed her...

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: What happened?  What's Earl doing here?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: He found us, he shot her...he killed her...

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Booth, listen to me...Booth!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: He killed her...

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: We got to get out of here.  Do you understand?  We got to get out of here right now!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: No.  It stops now.  It stops here.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: What do you mean?  Look.  We can make still make it work.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Dwayne's dead.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I know, I know.  Dwayne's dead, but we can deal with it.  We'll pin it on him.  The DEA was driving Jesse's car. No car phone.  No radio.  They couldn't have called me in.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Dwayne had the opportunity, just like us.  He was at the scene.  He grabbed the cash.  Of course.  This is perfect!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: It's too late...

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: It's NOT too late!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Yes it is.  I'm calling it in.  Right now.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: You're the one who's nuts! There's no one left to touch us, Booth.  We're home free!  We just plant a little of the money on Dwayne, and it's all ours.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: It's not about the money anymore. Can't you see that?  It's about

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Just one more.  This one knocks off all the rest.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I can't.  I can't go on.  I can't keep lying...killing.  That's not me.  That's not US.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: That'll bring me down, too. Eventually.  You gotta know that.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Uh huh.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: And you're solid on that?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Rock solid.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: You gentlemen look like you're about to toss your collective cookies.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Why don't you get to the point.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: My point, well...

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Listen Earl.  I covered for you. For both of you.  I put my ass on the line to save yours, so don't pull a hostile tone with me!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: What's your offer, Jesse?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: My offer?  Well I'd say it's a fair one, like I said we're friends.  All I want is my share, which I guess is...

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Besides, I'm not stupid, Earl. The tape was a basic Maxell D-80.  You can buy 'em at any store.  There's no way they can pin anything on me.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: All right, Jesse, we'll play it your way, under one condition.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I'm all ears.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: We're going to wait.  All of us, until everything dies down.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Well, I don't know...

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: That's the deal.  If you don't like it, forget it, no one wins.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Ok...I'll wait.  For now. But I'm going to need a little advance, to oil the wheels, so to speak.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I understand your logic, Booth, but I don't think...two thousand's going to raise any eyebrows, do you?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Two thousand...

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: By Friday.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: There's going to have to be a change in our arrangement.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: What are you proposing?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I want my share. All of it.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I don't like getting grilled by that DEA bitch, I don't like taking that kind of heat!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: None of us like it!

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Well I don't know what's going to happen next -- she's pressing this, another interrogation, another problem.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Just take it in stride.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I'm not gonna take --  I'm not gonna take it in stride.  I had a good run turn to shit on me like that -  cleaned me out.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: I was beginning to think you weren't going to show.  That can't be all of it.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: No.  It's not.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: You don't expect us to believe that do you?

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: You better believe it if you know what's good for you!

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: Come on, Booth.  Don't let him do this!!!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Don't have much choice, Jesse. You saw to that!

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: You're only screwing yourselves over!  Helllllp!  HELLLLLP!  SOMEBODY!!!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Shut up, Jesse.

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: HELLLLLP!!!!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Whoa, Earl!

turns.speaker: JESSE
turns.text: OKAY! IT'S UNDER MY DESK!!  TAPED TO THE BOTTOM SIDE!!!

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: What are you doing, Earl?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: How are ya?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Thank you.  Now, do you remember seeing any vehicles traveling near the site, on your way to or from?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: No.  Why?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Because someone may have gotten away.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Could it have been in the Mercedes?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Maybe.  That's where it was during Denning's last report.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Normally we would have tracked him with a wiretap, but it was standard for him to occasionally drop out when working with these guys. The last we heard from him was two days ago.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: You mean that guy was an agent?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Yes.  Wife and a kid.  Don't blame yourself, Deputy.  You did all you could.  You have our deepest gratitude...and my personal thanks.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Well, we have one lead and that's what I'm looking into next.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Denning was wearing a bug.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Yeah?  So?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: It's odd.  I don't know how Denning had the time, or the ability to buy something local, based on his situation.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I have to go to the bank before it closes.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I gotta take some money out, that's what for.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: There's an ATM on Speedwell Avenue.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Yeah but I need to take out four hundred dollars and the ATM will only give me three.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Well, not that I wouldn't sugar bun but Earl's in a bind.  They're going to take his car.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: He's irresponsible.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Ah hell, he'd do the same for me.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Has he?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: No.  But he would, probably.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Get a room in a nice hotel for a few hours...

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I might have to look into that...

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Heard you had quite a night.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: It was all over the local news. Dwayne was there, acting all official.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Nothing's wrong.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Oh.  You coming by tonight?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Are you sure you're OK?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Yeah I'm fine.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I'm just tired is all.  I'll see you tonight OK baby?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: OK.  I love you.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I love you too.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Sally?  I was beginning to think he wasn't gonna leave.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I'm in here.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: You got me something?  What's the occasion?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: You deserve it is the occasion.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: What happened to your cheek? SALLY Oh I...nothing...

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Nothing happened?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Dwayne got a little tipsy is all. He doesn't handle pressure well.  It's over.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Like hell it's over.  You told me he wasn't doing this anymore.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: He's not, he's...

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: That son of a bitch.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Booth.  Don't.  It's nothing. It's not worth it.  Remember what happened the last time?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Let's not get into this again. I know him.  If you said something, he'd take it out on me.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: And I'd take it out on him.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: And I'd end up a widow in two ways.  Let's forget it.  I'll just be a little more careful next time.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: There isn't gonna be a next time. We're gonna get out of here.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: You're worth every last penny.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Well, I can't let you down now, can I?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I told him I bought the lingerie, as a surprise.  I don't think he suspects anything, but now you know, if he mentions it.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: How the hell did he find it?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: He started digging through my closet, something he never does.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Great...

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: It's OK, Booth, it's no big deal.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Let's hope so. SALLY If he asks me again, I'm gonna tell him I returned it all.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Dammit, I'm so sick of this.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Every night I think about you sleeping with him, him slobbering all over you.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: He doesn't slobber, he just snores. And I told you we haven't...done anything in over a year.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: It doesn't matter...he's next to you.  You know, I always say to myself, you should have left him years ago. Why didn't you?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I used to think he was something, once...  I was eighteen, I didn't know any better, and he had something steady to offer.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Let's just get out of here, get out of this -- place.  We'll drop out, get a house have some kids, get a satellite dish...

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I hate it when you talk like this.  Go on.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: We'd... I don't know...go to California, New York, maybe a house on a Swiss mountainside...

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: It'd have to be Switzerland to make sure Dwayne never finds us.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: So do I.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I love you Sally.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I love you.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: A satellite dish?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Well I was just throwing out ideas...

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: How are we going to do all this?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I'm going to quit.  That's what has to happen first.  Then we're going to tell him.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I don't know, Booth.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I'll be there for you.  He won't try anything while I'm there.  I promise.  I'll protect you.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: When do you expect this inheritance stuff to be straightened out?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Shouldn't be long.  A couple of weeks maybe.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Can you rely on how much they said you'd get?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: It'll be more than enough.  We can get out of here...

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Why does that bother you?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I'm not sure why.  It's just, I've never been anywhere else...

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Sally there's a whole world out there.  We can have a new home. A real home, not some tin-plated dump.  What are you giving up?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I don't know.  My friends...

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: We'll meet new people. You might have friends out there you never met.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Yeah, I guess you're right.  It's just...all so sudden...

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Yeah, it is...

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: Do you wanna tell me what that was all about?

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Yeah.  I want to tell you everything.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Things just got a little screwed up, that's all.

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: I don't believe it.

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: I swear to you, it's true...

turns.speaker: BOOTH
turns.text: Sally, do you love me?

turns.speaker: SALLY
turns.text: You know I do.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Yeah, I've seen him.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: What did he buy?

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: I don't remember.  We get a lot of people in here.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Could it have been this?

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Be more specific.  A month, a week...

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: A week ago, at most.

turns.speaker: MARTIN
turns.text: Thanks for your time.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Test the product?

turns.speaker: CLIFF
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: Sounds like you don't trust me.

turns.speaker: CLIFF
turns.text: Business is business.  Now where the hell is it?  I wanna get out of here.  That's the plan, we're just flunkies, you know what I'm saying?

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: You didn't answer my question. Are you saying my word is of no value to you?

turns.speaker: CLIFF
turns.text: You said that, I didn't.

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: I have a better plan.  You want to hear it?

turns.speaker: CLIFF
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WILLIE
turns.text: I have a better plan.
